word: When opportunity offers, our people should purchase properties away from the cities, on which are buildings already erected and fruit orchards already in bearing. Land is a valuable possession. Connected with our sanitariums there should be lands, small portions of which can be used for the homes of the helpers and others who are receiving a training in medical-missionary lines.--Ms. 109, 1902, pp. 7, 8. ("The Favor of God of More Value Than Worldly Honor," August 11, 1902.)
